resources.string: User with provided username already exists. Try again.

Welcome to Dino Trivia! In this app, you get to play a fun game by answering trivia questions.

You will not only enjoy yourself, but learn new facts with the trivia questions as well! By answering questions correctly, you also earn points towards some awesome dinosaur facts!

Just tap 'Start Game', choose from the many question categories, choose a difficulty, and tap go to start your game.

Now what are you waiting for, GO PLAY!

string-array.name: Parasaurolophus
string-array.item: Parasaurolophus lived in what is now North America. Maybe one lived near you?
Don\'t worry. Parasaurolophus was a herbivore.
Parasaurolophus was on average 31ft long and almost 6ft tall.
Parasaurolophus was first discoverd in 1921 by Charles H. Sternberg.
Because of its diet, its teeth were constantly being replaced.
Parasaurolophus had a cranial crest used for communication and thermoregulation.

string-array.name: Brachiosaurus
string-array.item: Brachiosaurus had a long neck, small head, and large body.
Brachiosaurus was a large dinosaur! But it was a herbivore.
Brachiosaurus could eat up to 880lbs of food a day!
It lived in what is now North America.

string-array.name: Sauropoda
string-array.item: Sauropoda had long necks, long tails, small heads, and big legs.
They were some of the largest land animals of their time.
Sauropoda was named by O.C. Marsh.
They had air sacs in their bones, reducing the weight of their long necks.
They formed herds and protected each other from predators.
Sauropoda replaced a tooth every 14 days.
Sauropoda had a diet consisting of plants and leaves.

string-array.name: Ankylosaurus
string-array.item: Ankylosaurus had a length of about 30ft and weighed about 6.5 tons.
They had a ball at the end of their tails for self-defense.
It also had body armor to protect itself.
Ankylosaurus had a diet of plants.
They were slow dinosaurs but could move quickly if needed.

string-array.name: Apatosaurus
string-array.item: Apatosaurus traveled up to 25 miles each day in search for food.
Apatosaurus ate 880lbs of food a day.
Apatosaurus swallowed stones to help digest the plants it ate.
It used its tail for self-defense.
It lived for up to 31 years!
Apatosaurus could run on its hind legs.

string-array.name: Allosaurus
string-array.item: Allosaurus was a carnivore and had no natural predators.
Allosaurus is a common dinosaur in museums.

string-array.name: Velociraptor
string-array.item: Velociraptor was about as big as a large turkey.
Velociraptor was capable of climbing trees.
Velociraptor liked to eat their catch live.
Despite having feathers, they could not fly.
It was a very fast runner.
Velociraptor often stole food from other dinosaurs.
It was not a very smart dinosaur.

string-array.name: Stegosaurus
string-array.item: Stegosaurus is the state dinosaur of Colorado.
Stegosaurus had spikes on its tail for self defense.
Stegosaurus had plates on its skin for self defense as well.
Stegosaurus could only move at a speed of up to 5mph.
They lived in what is now North America and Europe.
Stegosaurus was about 30ft long, 14ft tall, and weighed 5.5 tons.

string-array.name: Triceratops
string-array.item: Triceratops weighed about the same as a truck.
Triceratops had horns for self defense.
They were herbivores and ate a lot!
Triceratops is one of the most widely recognized dinosaurs.

string-array.name: Tyrannosaurus_rex
string-array.item: They were about 42ft long and weighed 7 tons!
Tyrannosaurus rex walked on two legs and used its tail to balance itself.
Tyrannosaurus rex had some of the largest teeth amongst all the carnivorous dinosaurs.
Despite its small arms, their arms were powerful and had sharp claws.
Tyrannosaurus rex is the most well known dinosaur.
They could run up to 20mph after prey.
They were one of the biggest, meanest meat eaters.
